Package src

Class Roster

java.lang.Object
src.Roster
public class Roster
extends java.lang.Object
Contains array data structure that contains list of students in the Roster. Grows automatically in increments of 4 if the array is full and contains methods that interact with the list of students.
Author:
Christian Osma, Liam Smith

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private static int NOT_FOUND  
    private Student[] roster  
    private int size  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Roster()
    Initializes student roster to an array of size 4 and current size of 0.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean add​(Student student)
    Takes the student from the params and adds that student to the roster.
    void changeMajor​(Student student, Major major)
    Changes the inputed Student's major to the Major that was also given to the method.
    boolean contains​(Student student)
    Method returns true if the student was found in the roster and false otherwise.
    private int find​(Student student)
    This method loops through the list of students and looks for the specific student in the params.
    Student[] getBySchool​(java.lang.String string)
    Returns a list of students that attend the corresponding school passed into the method, sorted by Profile.
    private void grow()
    Creates a new array that contains 4 more elements than the current list and copies the students into the new array.
    void print()
    Prints the roster in standard output sorted by the student's Profile (last name, first name, and date of birth).
    void printBySchoolMajor()
    Prints roster to standard output sorted by school, major.
    void printByStanding()
    Prints roster to standard output sorted by standing
    boolean remove​(Student student)
    Removes the specific student from the roster and returns true if it has succeeded.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      private static final int NOT_FOUND
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • roster

      private Student[] roster

    • size

      private int size

  • Constructor Details

    • Roster

      public Roster()
      Initializes student roster to an array of size 4 and current size of 0.

  • Method Details

    • find

      private int find​(Student student)
      This method loops through the list of students and looks for the specific student in the params. Returns index or -1 if the student is not found.
      Parameters:
      student - : student to be found in the roster
      Returns:
      index of the student in the array of -1 if not found

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Creates a new array that contains 4 more elements than the current list and copies the students into the new array.

    • add

      public boolean add​(Student student)
      Takes the student from the params and adds that student to the roster.
      Parameters:
      student - : student to be added to the roster
      Returns:
      true if the student has been added

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(Student student)
      Removes the specific student from the roster and returns true if it has succeeded. Returns false if the student was not found.
      Parameters:
      student - : student to be removed from the roster
      Returns:
      true if the student has been removed

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(Student student)
      Method returns true if the student was found in the roster and false otherwise. Calls the find() method to find the student.
      Parameters:
      student - : student to be found in the roster
      Returns:
      true if the student is found in the roster

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints the roster in standard output sorted by the student's Profile (last name, first name, and date of birth).

    • printBySchoolMajor

      public void printBySchoolMajor()
      Prints roster to standard output sorted by school, major.

    • printByStanding

      public void printByStanding()
      Prints roster to standard output sorted by standing

    • getBySchool

      public Student[] getBySchool​(java.lang.String string)
      Returns a list of students that attend the corresponding school passed into the method, sorted by Profile.
      Parameters:
      string - : String representation of the school
      Returns:
      Student array of students that attend that specific school

    • changeMajor

      public void changeMajor​(Student student, Major major)
      Changes the inputed Student's major to the Major that was also given to the method.
      Parameters:
      student - : the student that wants their major changed
      major - : the major the student wants to change into
